Description: Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Waterloo, ON, Canada; Toronto, ON, Canada. Minimum qualifications: • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience. • 5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms. • 3 years of experience with full stack development, across back-end such as Java, Python, GO, and/or C++ codebases, and front-end experience including JavaScript and/or TypeScript, HTML, CSS or equivalent. • 3 years of experience testing, maintaining, and/or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture. Preferred qualifications: • Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field. • 1 year of experience in a technical leadership role. • Experience developing accessible technologies. About the job Google's software developers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for software developers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software developer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our software developers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward. With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions. Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems. Responsibilities • Write and test product or system development code. • Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies. • Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency). • Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback. • Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form

Description

The Canadian Gap Year Association is a non-profit organization supporting youth choosing to push pause on formal education to pursue experiential learning through work, volunteer, travel and personal interest activities. Students take gap years for many reasons such as: addressing financial need, mental or physical health concerns, gaining clarity on career or educational prospects, or deepening their understanding of themselves or the world.
Our mission is to reduce systemic barriers to this beneficial life-event by reducing the stigma of intentional “time outs,” redefining societal understanding of gap year objectives, activities and accessibility and by fostering awareness at the secondary and post-secondary educational levels.


CanGap has been chosen to deliver micro-grants through the Federal Government’s Canadian Service Corps program (Employment and Social Development Canada). CanGap will help Canadian youth identify local social/environmental issues, design and implement a service project, provide up to $1000 in funding per project and help youth develop the leadership, networking, social justice and project management skills to set them up for success on their future pathways.


The Problem: Gap Year youth are ready to take on these projects but most are not aware that this newly funded program exists. They are looking elsewhere for volunteer opportunities and missing this incredible program.


Be Part of the Solution: CanGap is hiring a Marketing & Communications Manager to increase our reach with the overall goal of supporting more young people developing transferrable and life skills through and extended period of experiential learning and execution of service projects. Help us with marketing and communications initiatives through a mix of strategy, tactical execution, storytelling and content development.


Responsibilities

Strategy

Work with the CanGap team to develop a multi-audience, multi-platform program-awareness strategy and marketing plan.
Work within the program budget that encompasses email and social media marketing, paid advertisements, ambassador/influencer content partnerships, print marketing, direct mail.
Target strategic educational and youth organization to extend outreach efforts.
Content Development & Digital Marketing

Write, design & execute strong email campaigns, automated sequences, targeted list e-blasts
Create social media content that drives engagement, focusing on shareability, on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn & YouTube.
Maximize re-purposed content between and amongst channels


Key Attributes

Passion for experiential & service learning/gap years/youth development: Developing youth skills through gap year service projects takes passion and a deep understanding of its benefits that cannot be taught. Aligning with the Gap Year Movement and CanGap’s mission is essential.
Acutely aware of social and environmental justice issues and how they impact the gap year space, including the impact of race, racism and historical exclusion.
Ability to work remotely: work well independently, take initiative, manage multiple projects and deadline effectively, strong team communication, comfortable with project management software (AirTable), unafraid to ask clarifying questions, timely in escalating issues
Comfortable working as part of a small non-profit team where each member takes on a wide variety of tasks
Ability to adapt to changing situations and priorities
Strong organizational and analytic skills
Ability to navigate between voices: this role will work closely with youth (17–24-year-olds) and their parents and high-level professionals (school board directors) and must maintain appropriate communication for each audience.


Experience & Qualifications

2-3 years working in communication, content creation or marketing field
Knowledge of managing and optimizing a business YouTube Channel
Basic Video editing skills
Ability to work optimize social media posts through planning software, geo-tags, hashtags, keywords, discovery page optimization
Graphic design of social media posts, marketing material and workbooks/downloads
Copywriting experience for varied audiences and objectives
Experience with Meta, Google and YouTube ads
Google, Meta and social analytics qualification/certifications preferred


Compensation

$45,500 annually, first 3-months (contract funded by the Canadian Service Corps Grant)
$60,000 annually, thereafter. This role will expand to include the above functions for all of CanGap with the addition of weekly podcast editing, and virtual and in-person event management.


Benefits

35 hours per week
Flexible Schedule
Work from home (Internet stipend included)
Mentorship and sponsored trainings for up-skilling
2 weeks vacation


How to Apply

Fill out this expression of interest form before June 2nd, 2023. 



https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScAvk4NpCPjwJOu7ZyDQfvLdU82owNugKct2jLxtj8O4c_iKQ/viewform?usp=sf_link 



All applicants will be contacted the week of June 5th, 2023 with next steps.
CanGap is committed to workplace diversity, equity, and inclusion. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds, and we seek to maintain a welcoming, inclusive, and high-performing culture in our organization.

ob Description

The Manager, Agency Smartmail Marketing Solutions manages Canada Post’s relationships with Media Agencies with the objective of growing Canda Post’s direct mail advertising revenue via the indirect Agency sales channel.

As the primary and dedicated Canada Post contact and relationship owner for Media Agencies, the Manager, Agency Smartmail Marketing Solutions utilizes their Agency channel knowledge, to develop Agency awareness of Canada Post’s Smartmail Marketing solutions, through education and best practice sharing with Agency partners. This awareness is developed towards ensuring Agency adoption and effective positioning of Smartmail Marketing as a value-added component of their service offering to their customers.

Job Responsibilities

Below are the main job requirements and responsibilities for the Manager, Agency Smartmail Marketing Solutions.
• Secures, manages and leverages Agency partnership agreements with assigned key accounts to achieve revenue growth targets via the indirect Agency sales channel while ensuring long-term revenue potential for Canada Post and its Agency partners.
• Maintains and develops new & existing business relationships with Media Agencies and solves client requirements before they escalate, ensuring that solutions are identified and implemented by engaging the appropriate Canada Post resource such as Service and Operations.
• Develops and presents a compelling value proposition of Smartmail Marketing solutions to Agency partners as part of their offering in strategically allocating customer advertising spend.
• Analyzes Agency intelligence to identify business opportunities, and leverages internal resources such as data and marketing support to meet account plan strategy.

Job Responsibilities (continued)
• Utilizing a consultative approach with Agency partners, identifies Agency customer needs and develops new bundled product and/or service offerings for sale by Agency partners to their customers.
• Works closely with Industry Associations and internal marketing partners to gain customer insight and industry intelligence about possible enhancements and growth opportunities within the Media Agency sales channel while promoting the value of direct mail.
• Conducts Agency Business Reviews with all key account partners on a regular basis, to review past performance and to ensure commitment to quarterly forecasts. Monitors and audits contracts and compliance with assigned customers to ensure performance conformity to contract levels.

Qualifications

Education
• Completed post-secondary, preferably in Commerce or Marketing or a related field.

Experience
• Minimum 5 years of media sales experience and/or senior agency experience.

Other Candidate Requirements
• Proficient computer skills and competent with Microsoft Office programs.
• Ability to deliver effective presentations to agencies, on a variety of topics including Smartmail Marketing.
• Excellent team building and leadership skills and experience.
• Sound organizational, analytical and decision-making skills with proven abilities in problem solving.
• Strong interpersonal skills with an ability to build and maintain relationships.
• Strong oral and written communication skills.

Other Information

Safety Sensitive Positions

Employment Equity

Canada Post will represent Canada’s diversity and provide a safe and welcoming workplace that embraces and celebrates our differences. We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from women, Indigenous People, persons with disabilities and visible minorities.

Disability is defined as a persistent or episodic physical, sensory, or mental health condition and/or functional limitation. Disability includes both visible and hidden conditions and/or limitations that may impact vision, hearing, mobility, flexibility, dexterity, pain, learning, developmental, mental/psychological, and memory.

Conflict of Interest

Should you feel that you may be in an actual or potential Conflict of Interest in regard to this job opportunity, you must communicate with the designated Human Resources representative.

Our Leadership Behaviours

Decision Making – A champion of the organization who takes calculated risks and makes prudent, common sense decisions about current issues, future opportunities and resource requirements in a timely, well thought out manner that aligns with the corporation's best interests.

Accountability – An individual who strives for performance excellence and who holds themselves and direct reports accountable for decisions and actions and for learning from mistakes when intended results are not achieved.

Business Orientation – A proactive individual who understands the competitive nature of the business, and is committed to sustaining the business through excellent customer service and new business opportunities.

Execution – A focused and self-motivated individual who acts with a sense of urgency and delivers on time and within budget, by dealing effectively with challenges and ambiguous situations.

Leading People – A compelling communicator and leader who engages, motivates and inspires others to achieve results and who encourages personal growth and finding better ways of doing things.

Our Values

We value diversity as an essential part of who we are as a company, how we operate and how we see our future. We believe that attracting, developing, and retaining people who reflect the diversity of Canada is essential to our success because this matters to all communities and customers we serve.

Canada Post’s corporate values reflect the principles, beliefs and aspirations that guide our behaviour and shape our culture.

Safety – We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for all our stakeholders.

Customer – We serve Canadians with pride and passion.

Respect – We treat each other with fairness and respect.

Integrity – We act responsibly and with integrity.

Transformation – We will innovate and transform to win in the marketplace
